website_summaries.verdict: Will give you a solid overall level of performance in many different areas for several brands of vehicles.
pros: Very smooth fluid that delivers the smoother shifts and gear wear protection that you should demand
Protects against rust and corrosion better than other brands of fluids
Includes a handle on the bottle, meaning you can more easily pour the transmission fluid
cons: Taller than average bottle that can be difficult to store
A little pricey versus some others

customer_reviews.title: Also it may just be in my head but under Full Throttle it feels like the car pulls a tad bit harder than before
customer_reviews.text: Used on a 1999 C5 Corvette with the 6-speed manual T56 transmission. Before switching to Royal Purple I was having Synchro issues with first gear not wanting to fully go into gear on the random occasion. Since switching, rowing through the gears is noticeably smoother and I've not had any issues getting it into 1st gear since. Also it may just be in my head but under Full Throttle it feels like the car pulls a tad bit harder than before. (differential fluid was changed to the RP 75w 90 at the same time, so it may be a combination of new gear oil in both) Either way, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: T56 with carbon blockers = happiness!
customer_reviews.text: Great fluid! It gets pretty hot out here and my t56 in the v cooks oem fluid in no time. Was not happy about synthetics and regular dex3 but this stuff keeps it substantially cooler by around 30 degrees. Have not gotten it about 145 when the old would be 180 and would hit 210-215 on long road trips. Not sure how it would do with cold weather due to the thicker viscous but it's a non issue in the desert.
customer_reviews.author: The big tuna lv

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a 2003 Focus SVT Getrag 6 speed gearbox. There is a lot of controversy surrounding what the proper fluid would be for this trans, however others have used this synchromax with good results so I did as well. It shifts great at 14 below zero and has been great now that its warming up as well. I will update if my trans flies apart.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Seems like my 98 M3 is much smoother since changing out ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems like my 98 M3 is much smoother since changing out the manual transmission fluid. Only 50k on this Sunday driver, but was starting to feel notchy. Sealed for life is BS, change your fluid every 30-40k, I'm a believer now too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended by my mechanic to use this on my manual transmission to make the shifts a lot smoother and I was genuinely surprised at how much of a difference it made. For reference I have a honda s2000 which is known to have a very mechanical feeling shift action, I had used the recommended oem Honda fluid but was still having some problems until I used this, honestly I'd recommend it to anyone who has a fully- synchronized modern manual transmission, especially on a Honda.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well in my 2005 Mini Cooper S. I used Redline first (Red Line Synthetic 75W80 Manual Transmission) The shifts were notchy. Royal Purple made shifts smooth again! I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: tightymitan

customer_reviews.title: NSG370 manual
customer_reviews.text: Let’s face it, the Daimler sourced NSG370 in the 05 - 06 TJs and 07 - 18 JKs is a decent transmission. But in the Wrangler’s has never been admired for its smoothness nor refinement. At just under 2 quarts of fluid capacity, it’s best to source the finest on the market. I’ve found RPsyncmax to be superior over Valvoline’s Syncromesh. The notchiness is all but gone, shifts smooth and improved. Not cheap but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Guy T

customer_reviews.title: No real difference felt
customer_reviews.text: Can't say good or bad about the product other than it was time to change the fluid and this worked but can't say that I feel any improvement over the stock fluid. Not much more expensive so no harm done. I trust the name and other products of theirs were well worth it, so....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quieted down 1999 S10 gearbox
customer_reviews.text: Whelp, I read the reviews and went for it. This stuff really quieted down the gearbox in my wife’s S10 with 360,000 miles on it. I’m really amazed at the difference it made. Thanks everyone who reviewed this product, I wouldn’t have ever shelled out the cash on this stuff without you. Supremely satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: Dream product for S2000
customer_reviews.text: Perfect product for the manual transmission of my Honda S2000. Smooth as silk shifting for one of the best transmissions ever made
customer_reviews.author: Doc Landis

customer_reviews.title: Improved shifts
customer_reviews.text: Used in 1991 5-sp. Mustang transmission, as shifting was getting rough, lots of vibration. After draining and refilling with Royal Purple, much improved, more damped, less vibration. It's only a trans oil, but probably the best you can buy. Worth the extra dollars I think.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A+++++
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 bottles to put in my brand new 2018 camaro with TR6060 trans. Got rid of the notchy shifty and works fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2008 M3 & my 6 speed manual was beginning to get hard to go into certain gears so I went with this as an OEM replacement. I’ve driven about 100 miles since the fluid change and I feel no shifting difference whatsoever. I give it 3/5 as it’s advertised use did not work
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a recommended gearbox oil for my Honda S2000
customer_reviews.text: This is a recommended gearbox oil for my Honda S2000. The bottle shape does not allow the usual little quart-size hand pump to reach all the oil, though, so it needs to be decanted into a normal shaped bottle if you need the full quart.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck S

customer_reviews.title: 2012 Dodge Challenger
customer_reviews.text: I have a Challenger and the shifting has always sucked to the point where I was thinking I need to relearn how to release a clutch pedal. I noticed Immediate smoother shifting once fluid circulated through. Seems it has eliminated the jamming in and out of gears feeling. It a must have for the Challenger enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: earlthepearl8166

customer_reviews.title: Smoother solid shifting, even in freezing temps....
customer_reviews.text: Using this in my M82 2014 Mustang 5.0 transmission, and it works flawlessly even tho this M82 transmission has a very sketchy performance history. This Royal Purple fluid has seriously enhanced the shifting and overall performance of my transmission, even in sub-freezing temps here in Indiana!
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Good in brz so far 6 months 1st to 2nd way better
customer_reviews.text: Used in my Subaru brz that we have all been having issues with the manual trans this is the best product I've used so far it's been about 6 months now about to see how winter is... but so far so good and I've tryed about 4 other fluids to come to this conclusion
customer_reviews.author: Robert Saagim

customer_reviews.title: Royal Purple Synchromax for Civic Type R
customer_reviews.text: The Synchromax is a correct manual transmission fluid replacement for the 2017-2020 Civic Type R. It has a lower viscosity at cold temperatures than the Amsoil Manual Synchromesh Fluid. Both alternatives are great, but the Synchromax has better fluid properties at colder temperatures for the gear box.
customer_reviews.author: Oreo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great performance!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I had swapped Honda MTF into my 03 civic about a year ago, with noticeable improvements in shifting. About a month ago I decided to switch to the Royal Purple MTF and my transmission is quieter, smoother, and easier to rev-match. My dog really appreciates the smoother shifting too!
customer_reviews.author: Filo

customer_reviews.title: Transmission shifting much smoother
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my T5 transmission after doing a clutch/TOB in my 98 Mustang v6. I thought it had synchro issues, i.e. not going into gear, but after using this stuff it made my trans shift much smoother. It's not perfect, but with how worn out my transmission is, it's breathed new life into it. It's not magic, but it worked wonders for my application. Totally worth the high price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Martin

customer_reviews.title: Used it in Honda S2000 transmission
customer_reviews.text: Omg shifts so smooth. Doesn’t pop out of second anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Zam guy

customer_reviews.title: Immediate improvement
customer_reviews.text: Changed out the fluid in my T5 transmission, before changing in neutral clutch out you could hear the gears in the transmission, now with Royal Purple in it, quiet, no sound, plus shifting is smoother, so much better than stock fluid, recommend using great product
customer_reviews.author: chevy58

customer_reviews.title: Poor Cold Weather Performance
customer_reviews.text: I was using this fluid briefly in the MT-82 transmission of my 2014 Mustang GT. It's cheaper than OEM fluid, but the positives end there. Compared to the "DCT fluid" Ford uses/recommends, shifts felt clunky. Cold weather performance is extremely poor. If you live somewhere where the temperature outside is never below 70F, you might be OK with this fluid, but I can't recommend it for New England.
customer_reviews.author: Krakissi

customer_reviews.title: Smooth sailing (err... shifting)
customer_reviews.text: Usage: I run an old '84 Chrysler Laser with a freshly swapped A555 transmission out of an '87 Daytona Shelby Z. There isn't a lot to this product, it's only transmission fluid, after all, so I'll skip the pros and cons and just go straight to my experience using it. I have yet to experience any problems running this fluid in the transmission. It shifts smooth as butter and doesn't grind a gear no matter what I do, except reverse if I shift fast (but most older stick shifts will grumble a little going into reverse quick). Works a lot better than the factory fill recommendation for the A555 (motor oil).
customer_reviews.author: NeatHedgehog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent oil for manual trannys
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my manual transmission 2003 bmw 325i. It works great, very nice shifts once the fluid is only slightly warmed up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Changed in my Jeep TJ at 55K miles when my pilot bushing went out and had to pull the transmission. Noticed considerable difference. Trans is quieter and shifts smoother. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith R. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Helped my high rpm shifting in my 2015 wrangler 6 speed.
customer_reviews.text: I would occasionally fight my 2015 wrangler to go into 3rd or 4th year when "getting on it" this cured my issue 100%. It also made shifting at low speeds better. It is slightly stickier until it warms up so in very cold weather you might find the OEM fluid better. But in Sacramento the heavier fluid works much better when hot.
customer_reviews.author: @Californiajeeping

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Must buy for your manual sports car! My 6 speed feels smooth like butter and it definitely gave me a piece of mind flushing my old and putting this in.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Coburn

customer_reviews.title: It's wroth the money.
customer_reviews.text: My 2006 Mustang GT was having a hard time going into second gear smoothly. When you were trying to speed shift second gear would grind before going into gear. After i added the royal purple gear oil it made the shifting a lot smoother. No more grinding going into second gear.
customer_reviews.author: stanley

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Man, I tell you- I didn't think I'd notice such a big difference shifting. Switching gears now is quiet, buttery smooth, and such a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Wordsmith

customer_reviews.title: Trusted
customer_reviews.text: Used this for 2003 Land Rover Discovery II transfer case. Discovered it in Land Rover forums.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is great it make my shifty much better for my old truck. Is like from old to new. Is great product. It does a great job
customer_reviews.author: Cesario Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Smoother shifting
customer_reviews.text: Replaced old fluid in 2007 Mustang GT manual transmission with this and noticed smoother shifts and less noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not what they say...
customer_reviews.text: No changes at all, I drive a 5 speed, 1995 325i, and was hoping improvement in the shifting, but nothing at all. Expensive product for lack of claimed results.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Smooth shifting JK jeep has a happy transmission now
customer_reviews.text: 1st 2nd and reverse gears started to be occasionally difficult. This came highly recommended and for good reason. It was obvious this made an improvement right away. Performance replacement fluid at a reasonable price. I will be using this stuff in my other 2 manual trans vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: MetroMike

customer_reviews.title: Better than ATF for my Tremec!
customer_reviews.text: Previously used Royal Purple ATF in my 6 speed manual Tremec Dodge Challenger. It was better than stock, but still had a little nibble from 1st to 2nd. Replacing with Synchromax improved it to the point where the nibble is basically gone. Very happy with the change.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Troyus

customer_reviews.title: Now it's super smooth, tho first is still sometimes tricky
customer_reviews.text: This stuff totally improved the shifting in my 06 Mustang GT. I was getting a grinding noise when I'd go into first, but only until the car was warmed up.. And shifting, especially down shifting and into first from a stop, required extra effort. Now it's super smooth, tho first is still sometimes tricky, but a lot smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: The only MTF that keeps my Jeep NV3550 transmission running quiet
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: I used this on my 2001 s2000 ap1
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my 2001 s2000 ap1 works great and smooth shifts with this; I would say it's better then OEM
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Like the product my transmission feels better when shifting. I will run this product from now on...thinking about using it for my 05 silverado auto
customer_reviews.author: Chevron2000

customer_reviews.title: There was some noise in 1st and 2nd gears and ...
customer_reviews.text: There was some noise in 1st and 2nd gears and it quietened the noise by 90%. It has not been in the transmission but about 3 weeks so I don't know what the long term will be.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my remanufactured manual transmission and it feels and works as well as the original. Hoping hit helps the transmission last longer. The OEM transmission lasted more than 225,000 miles before the bearings loosened to the point the output seals were leaking. Replacing the seals didn't help. Unfortunately it took 10 years to put that kind of mileage on the car so I will not be able to give a long term review.
customer_reviews.author: R. C. Dickey

customer_reviews.title: Although I am pretty sure my syncros are messed up from all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Used for my 2006 Mustang GT manual box, smoothed up the shifts for sure, was an obvious improvement. Although I am pretty sure my syncros are messed up from all the drag strip and road course runs. And of course driving like I stole it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hankus

customer_reviews.title: Honda S2000
customer_reviews.text: The difference is day and night, very good quality. now i can shift smother.
customer_reviews.author: Armando

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth shifts!
customer_reviews.text: Using in my BMW 540i 6 speed standard, shifts are no longer notchy and very smooth, I will update back here if I have issues with it but it is a must have for bmw transmissions, redline d4 is good also, I’d say they both are equivalent
customer_reviews.author: Zoro

customer_reviews.title: Good for bimmers.
customer_reviews.text: Used in BMW e46 manual trans. In Wisconsin. No problem in -30 temps. A little stiff shifting but warms up and is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: ilovediving73

customer_reviews.title: but i'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Noticed a big change in smoothness and lack of resistance in my 330Ci gearbox as soon as i changed it. Old fluid may have been 125k old....so....not too surprising, but i'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Use this in your manual transmission if Royal Purple recommends it. Much better than ATF
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the ATF that is supposed to be used in my manual transmission. Shifts a lot smoother, and will likely extend transmission life.
customer_reviews.author: JunkyardDog

customer_reviews.title: Chevy Cruze Eco MT
customer_reviews.text: No joke this stuff is amazing. Made the shifts buttery smooth after going with this fluid. A little on the expensive side but damn are the shifts smooth.
customer_reviews.author: dspot

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Changed fluid out on my 2013 Dodge Dart 6 speed Rallye with this fluid and what a difference it had made. This fluid will help prolong the life of your tranny. Great for racing or track.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Bowmer

customer_reviews.title: incorrect product descrition
customer_reviews.text: This stuff will ONLY work in an auto tranny that will accept manual fluid. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: mike lux

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great...
customer_reviews.text: Much smoother shifts and much quieter transmission when idling. My fluid was less than a year old, but I was changing all fluids, so I put royal purple in the transmission. I seriously was really surprised by the smoothness and quiteness.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff, smoother shifts.
customer_reviews.text: Used for manual transmission in 2008 Mustang GT. ( Currently with over 247,000 miles)
customer_reviews.author: Devyn

customer_reviews.title: Better than OEM
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my NV1500 transmission on my 99 GMC Sonoma, much smoother shifting, better than the OEM
customer_reviews.author: Andres Torres

customer_reviews.title: Royal Purple ROY01512 Synchromax synthetic CHROMAX, 1 quart
customer_reviews.text: Great gearbox oil. I used this in my Getrag 6 speed box in my 97 supra turbo. I've been using it for years.
customer_reviews.author: ranger

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gearbox shifts the same as with the orignal oil with 160k miles on it. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ibuyeverythang

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff for tremec6060
customer_reviews.text: 2009 dodge challenger srt8 with tremec 6060..this stuff is awesome, my shifter just falls into place now..I feel a difference
customer_reviews.author: Chandler Stone

customer_reviews.title: Jeep was acting like synchros were on the way out
customer_reviews.text: Jeep was acting like synchros were on the way out...grinding a bit shifting from 1st to 2nd. Drained fluid from transmission and transfer case, refilled with this stuff...problem solved. Shifts like it should and runs smoother, quieter than before. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R.

customer_reviews.title: Transmission Fluid
customer_reviews.text: Transmission Fluid, Shifting my transmission is smooth even during cold season
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I am happy and would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my 2000 Wrangler transmission, which has a 5 speed manual. It smoothed out the shifting and overall drive noticeably. I am happy and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Smileytown

customer_reviews.title: Best stuff for BMW
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my E39 M5 i cannot believe how big of difference this makes in shifts 1 gear was a little stubborn on cold starts and 4th gear would slip if not put in properly now its almost as good as new tranny im putting royal purple in everything i own
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: I thought the 320z 5spd manual in my 210k 528i ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought the 320z 5spd manual in my 210k 528i was a goner but I decided to drain out BMW's "lifetime" fill oil and give this a shot. Completely silenced the gear whirr and it hasn't popped out of gear once yet no matter how hard I get on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Sarette

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than the stealership
customer_reviews.text: Been using it in my 2007 Jeep Liberty for the past 4ish years. Shifting is super smooth and it seems to be working perfectly with my manual transmission. It's a few dollars cheaper than the OEM fluid stealership, too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great oil for my dakota trans... Got Wrecked it 3 yrs later by a drunk!
customer_reviews.author: Fieldy84

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I like RP and they make quality fluids. I use them throughout my car and have never had anything bad to say about it. I have had their trans fluid in my car for the past 30,000 miles and it has worked well. Towards the end of the service life (30,000 miles) I was having some minor grinding when going into reverse but only when the car was cold and the air was cold (under 45 F). I just bought more to change out the old fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Taco

customer_reviews.title: Yea !! 3rd gear in Vtec in back
customer_reviews.text: Restored my crisp and flawless gear ratios better than regular Honda MTF !! 3rd gear always engages now i couldn't be happier !!
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: She now shifts like butter, well worth the extra cost of this ...
customer_reviews.text: Just put this in my '04 ranger MT5OD-R1 on a recommendation. 1st gear was getting a little notchy. She now shifts like butter, well worth the extra cost of this fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Rob V

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for the S197 Mustang 6-speed manual transmissions for a fraction of the OEM fluid
customer_reviews.text: Replaced fluid in our '12 Mustang GT, the transmission shifts sooooo much better! It also doesn't seem to want to lock out of 2nd any more. Sold me on it. I've had good luck with other brands in other applications, but I'm really happy with this fluid in our '12 Mustang GT Premium.
customer_reviews.author: BenC in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent manual trans oil
customer_reviews.text: Excellent manual transmission oil! I can really feel a difference in my 2006 Honda Civic Si. My shifts are super smooth now!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Rose

customer_reviews.title: 2013 Jeep Wrangler JK 6 speed transmission and transfer case
customer_reviews.text: 2013 Wrangler 6 speed shifts smoother, not night and day but certainly a noticeable improvement. The transfer case was night and day different. Shifting into 4wd was much improved. This is not snake oil, Royal Purple products are superior.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied purchased
customer_reviews.text: 2000 Jeep Wrangler TJ Sport- been running this oil since I purchased the Jeep. I have not put many miles on the jeep yet but just changing oil resulted in a smother, quieter transmission. Many reviews state this oil is one of the best and so far I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: If you drive a TJ, this is for you!
customer_reviews.text: This helped my 2005 TJ 6 speed with what I thought was a syndromes problem. Shifts smoother than ever now
customer_reviews.author: Pete Sauce

customer_reviews.title: Helped
customer_reviews.text: Helped an abused tranny run a little longer. Gears shift smoother and heat is a lot better. Used in 05 Jeep Wrangler NSG370
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: Do the switch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product can't go wrong. This product is not the typical synthetic you buy off the shelf. The additives in the product will prolong the life of your transmission. I used it my 2002 Mitsubishi Lancer OZ Rally manual transmission.
customer_reviews.author: Marcellus Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: My S2000 shifts like butter now. Pricey but so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: Shift for yourself
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff, trans is smooth. was time for a change in the Z3 and the specs are all over for standard trans oil. old oil was not bad but change time anyway. it improved shifting a noticable amount,not great but there.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W. Crews

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a dream on my 1999 Z3M
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a dream on my 1999 Z3M, had quite a notchy shift before, now it feels so much smoother. Definitely recommended for any 90's BMW ZF manual gearbox. For Z3M and E36 M3 owners, when you combine this oil with a CDV delete and a new clutch slave cylinder, you're in for a shock, I can not stop changing gear now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will use again.
customer_reviews.text: I did tons of research for the type of fluid for my 05 Ram and this was better than manufacturer specs at a comparable price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: My 2000 Jeep TJ had a hard time shifting into second gear. I read some other reviews on this product and it was just what the dr ordered! Jeep shifts so much better through all gears. Awesome product. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Farmboy

customer_reviews.title: Drained the old ATF from my Ford T-5 five speed ...
customer_reviews.text: Drained the old ATF from my Ford T-5 five speed replacing it with Royal Purple. Transmission shifts smoother, runs s bit quieter. This is the "cream of the crop" as to lubricants.
customer_reviews.author: Bill A

customer_reviews.title: All you have to say is royal purple and it's perfect every time
customer_reviews.text: Is royal purple or do I have to say five stars all the way
customer_reviews.author: Donald E.

customer_reviews.title: Fussy transmissions...
customer_reviews.text: It's curious how different transmissions like different oils. This stuff works beautifully in the big Getrag in my E39 M5 and, unlike certain other products on the market that worked great for a few months, shift quality holds up over time. I change it about every three years.
customer_reviews.author: JEM

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Shiped sooner than expected. If your have gear rollover noise on a zf5 give this product a try.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I used this product in my E30 1991 BMW 318is (Getrag 5-speed). The housing has a red label/orange label. I flushed out the old fluid and put in 1.3 bottles of RP. I only drove the car for a few miles and I can tell there was a positive difference in shifting. Overall shifting became easier. I'll update this review after some more break-in.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaper than whatever I would pay at the store ...
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than whatever I would pay at the store... But its too thin...I have a tremec 5 on my mustang and this is too thin....I still had whine from the syncros..if you want it. Get it. But be sure to add something to thicken it up...
customer_reviews.author: Mike Briceno

customer_reviews.title: It felt like I was shifting through marbles
customer_reviews.text: I used it in my 2002 C5 Corvette and removed it immediately. It felt like I was shifting through marbles, particularly when the fluid was warm for whatever reason. GM or Pennzoil Sycromesh is the only way to go with those cars I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Colley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only one for the nv3550 trans in my tj great stuff
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Premium product!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this product for my new 6 speed vehicle because of its reputation.I used both the transmission fluid and the gear oil and time will tell if I notice a significant difference. I do feel that I have used a premium product based on so many positive customer reviews.
customer_reviews.author: retired educator

customer_reviews.title: THE TJ TRANNY IS QUIET! FINALLY!
customer_reviews.text: We were sick of hearing the NV3550 being so loud, so I decided to flush my tranny and add this product. Let me tell you there was no difference, initially. After about my next oil change, 3000 miles or so, the trans had become significantly quieter and smoother shifting, especially 2->3 gear, which is very loud in the NV3550. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Well its oil
customer_reviews.text: Transmission still has all of its gears inside the case so I'd say it works just fine. I put it in my C6Z.
customer_reviews.author: KKrebs

customer_reviews.title: Smooth shifts, smooth running. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced "lifetime" (ha!) OEM trans fluid in BMW Z4 M Roadster. Made a huge difference! Shifting is much easier, smoother. Wish I had done it a while ago.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: My 2001 Ranger with 160K miles shifted smoother after replacing ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2001 Ranger with 160K miles shifted smoother after replacing the factory fill ATF. But get an actual pump, just squeezing the bottle to get the oil in the gearbox was a PAIN.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I guess it worked ? I could not tell much of a difference in my 94 Nissan 300zx
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Pope

customer_reviews.title: Best Trans Lube
customer_reviews.text: This is the best trans lube I have ever used. I am running it in a G56 6-speed manual in a Dodge Ram Diesel. After switching to this over the OEM fluid the trans shifts are much smoother. The trans is quieter than before.
customer_reviews.author: Muzzy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: The shifts are buttery smooth now. Get this if you want to help protect your transmission.
customer_reviews.author: guti

customer_reviews.title: Noticable improvement
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on other's recommendations and I was not sorry. Worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great for GM manuals
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in my 1988 Beretta. It usually takes the GM synthetic oil, but Royal Purple has a replacement with Synchromax. Trans shifts easier than ever now. With temps up in the 90's its still smooth and easy off the line and through the gears.
customer_reviews.author: David Politte

customer_reviews.title: Great for BMWs
customer_reviews.text: If you have a BMW that came with the ATF weight gearbox (manual transmission) fluid, this is the BEST upgrade for that fluid. Smooth shifting hot and cold. Works a lot better than Redline D4 ATF and Amsoil MTL.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Not for all cars like advertised
customer_reviews.text: I should have known with these universal fluids but it is just too thin for my e36 Bmw. Bigger danger of ruining synchros. Drained it out along with my $$.
customer_reviews.author: DT16

customer_reviews.title: the shifting is super
customer_reviews.text: Used this in my 2003 cobra, and wow, the shifting is super smooth
customer_reviews.author: henry
